strategies.title: Bollinge R’S friend (BB, MACD)
strategies.text:
Bollinger Bands (BB) is a world-famous momentum indicator created by financial analyst John Bollinger. If you are familiar with BB, you know how good it is in indicating trends and flats. This strategy lets you improve your trading experience by inviting Bollinger’s “best friend” — MACD.

A piece of theory
BB indicates asset volatility. When the price starts increasing or decreasing with intensity, the bands widen. On the contrary, when no significant price moves, the bands stay tight to the indicator’s middle line. The middle line shows the trend direction, up or down.
When Bollinger Bands start widening, be on alert. Conclude the trade only when the price exceeds the indicator's upper or lower band.

MACD consists of the MACD line and the signal line. The MACD line reacts to price changes faster than the signal line. The indicator also has a histogram that changes color depending on the price momentum intensity.

quick_reads.title: Simple trading book
quick_reads.text:
The U.S. Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged at the conclusion of its latest policy-setting meeting on Wednesday, as widely expected, but acknowledged recent progress on inflation, raising investor hopes that the central bank could begin cutting rates in the near future.

The Federal Open Market Committee, the FOMC, kept its benchmark rate in a range of 5.25% to 5.5%, as it has done over the past year as it battled elevated inflation.

However, recent data point to progress on inflation, suggesting that the Fed's restrictive policies are working.

However, recent data point to progress on inflation, suggesting that the Fed's restrictive policies are working.
